patterns: Where can I find about examinations?
responses: The Office of Examinations serves as the central location on campus for the administration of placement and testing services. The Office of Examinations runs the Examinations Testing Lab which is located at Gwendolyn Brooks Library, Room 144. At the Examinations Testing Lab, new and current students can take placement exams as part of getting started with registration for required English composition and Math courses., For more Information here is the link details

patterns: get me information about Student Health Insurance?
get me information about Student Health Insurance Wavier?
how to apply for Student Health Insurance?
Where can I find about Student Health Insurance?
How should i apply for Student Health Insurance Wavier
responses: All registered undergraduate students taking 12 or more credit hours, graduate students taking 9 or more credit hours, pharmacy students taking 12 or more credit hours and doctoral students taking 6 or more credit hours are automatically enrolled into the mandatory sickness and injury insurance through the university each semester. All International students are required to purchase the insurance plan for the school year. Part-time students taking 6-11 credit hours are eligible to enroll in this plan., For more info Visit

responses: The Wellness/Health Center works with CSU’s College of Health Sciences to increase health care access to the campus community., For more info visit or contact Phone: (773) 995-2011, Email: wellness@csu.edu
